metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0358 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
potential privilege escalation in virtiofsd

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-0358` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-block-extra - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-guest-agent - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-arm - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-common - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-data - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-gui - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-mips - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-misc - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-ppc - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-s390x - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-sparc - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-x86 - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-user - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-user-static - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
qemu-utils - 1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Jietao Xiao, Jinku Li, Wenbo Shen, Nanzi Yang

criterions.comment: qemu package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.0+dfsg-2expubuntu1.2').
